QUESTION ABOUT SOUND!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This game from Dopeman works, and I have 'finished' the game sort of. I have a few issues though. 

The game seems to have a lot of bugs, i heard the PC version of SCDA sucks because of this, so i assumed all the bugs came with the game, and not from Dopeman. 

However, I have played the xbox360 version of the game, and one of the biggest things i noticed is that there's a very tense and palpitating soundtrack that plays continuously, and the palpitation increases and becomes more intense whenever the player gets closer and closer to the enemy. 

Yet when i played the PC version from Dopeman, there's no such soundtrack at all, I played the whole game basically without music (except in a few cutscenes). So what the hell, i think the music is completely indispensable to this game. Is the lack of music in the PC version due to Dopeman, or just because the PC version sucks? 

Anyone else notice this?!?!?!?!?

Another great rip, Dopeman. Game runs smoothly and no technical bugs or problems.

I do wonder however if you intentionally ripped the upgraded gadgets out of the game or ripped the wrong version or something. Like ripped some sort of equipping screen before every mission. Because even after I complete the required missions for the gadgets they seem to be unaccessable. Also this seems to lack 1680x1050 resolution, but that might be just because this is a console game ported to PC. And this is going to the side of nitpicking but I'm not allowed to change a few controls in this, like the inventory and whistling, but this one might be down to stupid devs too, though.

Other than that great rip. The game itself though is a bit too linear for my taste. Earlier Splinter Cells have been more open.

Game is a fake, the actual game install is about 7.8 GB.  The download is 1.97GB?  Even with compression, I highly doubt you'll turn about 8GB into (my math sucks) 1/4th that.

Hammer down, your game is a fake.  It's not complete, and that's why you get all these runtime errors.  That is why you run into all these problems.

When you install the game from the -real- DVD, it installs the version of DirectX that is uses, so basically it reinstalls DirectX for you.  That's why you get more than half the errors as well.

for u guys/girls that have a buffer overrun error and cannot fix it through options, try to replaces the folder.
1. Extract as usually.
2. Go in to C:\Program Files and make a new Fodler named "Ubisoft"
3. Then go in to that folder and make another one name SCDA.
4. Now cut out all the files from the TCSCDA unpacked folder and place it into the SCDA.

I really hope that works because it did for me :).

TO all those who dont know how to patch a rip.
basically a patch needs the installation directory of the game and it finds it through registry. all you have got to do is make a key for it (windows 7)it works for others too
1.enter regedit in the search bar
2.now select HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE 
3.expand it
4.select SOFTWARE and expand it
5.now right-click on software and select New>key,now name the key as Ubisoft
6.make a new key by righclicking on ubisoft,name it "Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell Double Agent"
7.now right click on the blank space on the right
select New>String value.name it as InstallDir
now open it and write C:\TCSCDA where "C"  is the drive where you have copied the game and"TCSCDA"is the name of the game folder 
8.click ok and you are done! 
you can install  both the 1.01 and 1.02 patch this way
Thanks

for u guys/girls that have a buffer overrun error and cannot fix it through options, try to replaces the folder.
1. Extract as usually.
2. Go in to C:\Program Files and make a new Fodler named "Ubisoft"
3. Then go in to that folder and make another one name SCDA.
4. Now cut out all the files from the TCSCDA unpacked folder and place it into the SCDA.

I really hope that works because it did for me :).
